intro: Hieracium padcayense, commonly known as the Peruvian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cooler climates. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green to white ray florets, and it has a mat-forming growth habit. Hieracium padcayense is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
